Pk: 0
QuestionNumber: V1
Question: interviewer: unsuccessful calls – reasons for substitution
VariableLabel: Unsuccessful visit – HH1
Values: 1-6
        96
        97
        99
ValueLabels: 1=Refused to be interviewed
             2=Person never at home
             3=Empty premises
             4=Deaf/Foreign language
             5=Didn’t fit gender quote
             6=Other
             96=No unsuccessful visits
             97=Not applicable
             99=Missing data
Source: SAB
Note: Answered by interviewer, after instructions, “Select a household according to the walk pattern (i.e. fifth house on the right). If there is no one at home in the selected household on thee first try, make at least one more trip to the household before substituting. If there is no one at home after a second call, substitute that household with the next household found in the direction of the walk pattern.”

Pk: 0

             36=Welfare
             37=Other
             38=Nothing/No problems
             39=Development
             45=Regional cooperation
             46=Provide Loans
             47=Low agricultural prices
             48=Problems in marketing goods
             49=Protection for women
             50=Drought
             51=Other social Problems
             52=Tribalism/segregation
             96=No Further Answers
             98=Refused
             99=Missing data
Source: SAB99
Note: Respondent could give up to three responses.

Values: 1-5

             2= Influence others: Agree somewhat
             3=Do not influence: Agree somewhat
             4=Do not influence: Agree strongly
             5=Don’t agree with either
             9=Don’t know
Source: Zambia96

QuestionNumber: 31A
Question: what, if anything, does democracy mean to you
VariableLabel: What does democracy mean to you
Values: 0-14
        19-25
        29
        80-83
        91-92
        94-96
        98-99
        101
ValueLabels: 0=Don’t know, can’t/unable to explain
             1=Civil liberties/personal freedoms
             2=Voting/electoral choice/multiparty competition
             3=Social/economic development
             4=Government by the people/of the people/for the people
             5=Peace/Unity
             6=Governance/effectiveness/accountability
             7=Equality/Justice
             8=Rule of Law
             9=Personal security
             10=National Independence
             11=Majority Rule
             12=Group rights and freedoms/freedoms
             13=Power-sharing/Unity of government
             14=Government to provide civic education
             19=Other positive meanings
             20=Conflict/confusion
             21=Corruption/abuse of power
             22=Social/economic hardship
             23=Government of the rich
             24= Bad/poor government, weak implementation
             25=Colonialism, foreign concept/domination
             29=Other negative meanings
             80=Nothing
             81=Democracy meanings
             82=Too afraid to give opinion
             83=Does not matter
             91=Civilian politics/government
             92=Change of government/leadership/laws
             94=Never heard of democracy
             95=Other null/neutral meanings
             96=No further answer
             98=Refused/won’t explain
             99=Missing data
             101=Other
Source: Ghana 97       7
Note: Interviewer could prompt if necessary, “When you hear the word “democracy,” what is the first thing that comes to your mind?”  The English word “democracy” was always used, whether the rest of the question was in English or Swahili.

QuestionNumber: 34

Values: 1-3
ValueLabels: 1=Democracy is preferable to any other form of govt,
             2=A non-democratic govt, can be preferable
             3=Does not matter
             98=Refuse

QuestionNumber: 35

Values: 1-5
ValueLabels: 1=No expression of different views: Agree Strongly
             2=No expression of different views: Agree Somewhat
             3=Allow differences: Agree Somewhat
             4= Allow differences: Agree Strongly
             5=Don’t agree with either
             9=Don’t know
Source: Adapted from NDB

Pk: 0
QuestionNumber: 36
Question: a. all people should be permitted to vote, even if they do not fully understand all the issues in an election.    b. only those who are sufficiently well educated should be allowed to vote
VariableLabel: Everyone votes VS only educated vote
Values: 1-5
ValueLabels: 1=All vote: Agree strongly
             2=All vote: Agree somewhat
             3=Educated vote: Agree somewhat
             4=Educated vote: Agree strongly
             5=Don’t agree with either
             9=Don’t know
Source: Zambia 96
Note: The interviewer introduced the pair of statements in question 36 by saying, “Now we will return to pairs of statements. Please tell me which one you agree with most. Choose statement A or Statement B.” Then, the interviewer probed for strength of opinion.

Pk: 0

Values: 1-10
ValueLabels: 1=one
             2= two
             3=three

Pk: 0
QuestionNumber: 52
Question: what, in your opinion, is the structural adjustment programme supposed to do
VariableLabel: What is SAP supposed to do
Values: 0-16
        31-35
        97
ValueLabels: 0=Don’t know
             1=Improve the economy
             2=Improve living conditions
             3=Increase jobs/productivity
             4=Stabilization and fiscal balance
             5=Reform economic institutions
             6=Provide government services
             7=Make goods available
             8=To bring the country together
             9=Self reliance
             10=Other positive responses
             11=Increase investment
             12=Reduce inflation
             13=Hardwork
             14=Develop our natural resources
             15=Promote financial transparency
             16=Protect people’s health
             31=Bring hardship and difficulty
             32=Benefit the rich
             33=Devaluation of currency
             34=Increase inflation
             35=Corruption, looting, etc,
             97=Not applicable
Source: Ghana99
Note: This was an open-ended question.  Responses were recorded verbatim and given codes afterward.

Pk: 0

QuestionNumber: 57
Question: a. everyone should be free to earn as much as they can, even if this leads to differences in income between people.    b. the government should place limits on how much the rich can earn, even is this discourages some people from working hard

        9

             99=Missing data
Source: adapted from NDB
Note: 

Pk: 0
QuestionNumber: 58
Question: a. in rural areas, land should be owned by the community and allocated by the traditional rulers.    b. people should be able to own their own land, including buying and selling it, even in rural areas
VariableLabel: Community should own land VS individuals own land
Values: 1-5
ValueLabels: 1=Community owns: Agree strongly
             2=Community owns: Agree somewhat
             3=Individuals own: Agree somewhat
             4=Individuals own: Agree strongly
             5=Don’t agree with either
             9=Don’t know
Source: Ghana99
Note: 

Pk: 0

Values: 1-5

             2= Policies change often: Agree Somewhat

             2=Goods available: Agree somewhat
             3=Low prices: Agree somewhat
             4=Low prices: Agree strongly
             5=Don’t agree with either
             9=Don’t know
Source: Zambia 96

QuestionNumber: 72
Question: what in your opinion is a member of parliament supposed to do
VariableLabel: What is member of parliament supposed to do
Values: 0-13
        16-17
        19-32
        98-99
ValueLabels: 0=Don’t know
             1=Don’t know what a deputy is
             2=Write/defend the constitution
             3=Vote laws
             4=Ensure progress/save the country
             5=Represent/defend the population
             6=Help/do what the government wants him to
             7=Work for the well-being (of the family)
             9=Help to create jobs
             10=Search for the means/develop their community
             11=Help village/community to have social infrastructure
             12=Break the isolation of regions/villages by providing services
             13=Promote agriculture/food self sufficiency
             16=Parcel out the villages/land
             17=Bring public opinion to the attention of the government
             19=Play the role she was elected for
             20=Deal with the protection of children
             21=Gather in consideration of a vote
             22=Bring community problems to government's attention
             23=Advise the Head of State/work for the state/elect the President
             24=Inform the people on government position
             25=Guide mayor/help party
             26=Manage government/public interest
             27=Give money or other help
             28=Do nothing/personal interest
             29=Propagate disorder
             30=Cause expenditures
             31=Educate the population
             32=Promote women
             98=Refused
             99=Missing data
Source: Adapted from SAB
Note: Question was open ended.  Responses were recorded verbatim and coded afterwards.
